items.title: Query & Interact with Apps in Android 11 with Package Visibility
items.description:
Android 11 introduced several exciting updates for developers to integrate into their app experience including new device and media controls, enhanced support for foldables, and a lot more. In addition to new features there are also several privacy enhancements that developers need to integrate into their application when upgraded and re-targeting to Android 11. One of those enhancements is the introduction of package visibility that alters the ability to query installed applications and packages on a userâ€™s device.

items.title: PR Tracker for .NET projects
items.description:
This is a fun project from Microsoft MVP and .NET Foundation Board Member Layla Porter, that allows you to log and track your contributions to any open source .NET project marked with the Hacktoberfest label. Not only can you use it to track your contributions but the project can also be found on GitHub and openly welcomes PR's so you can even track work you have done on the tracker project, meta!

items.title: Using Styles in Xamarin.Forms: Implicit, Explicit and Inherit Styles
items.description:
Xamarin.Forms applications often contain multiple controls that have a similar appearance. Setting the appearance of each individual control can be repetitive and error prone. With styles you can make your XAML less verbose and the maintenance of the look and feel of your Xamarin.Forms app much simpeler. In this video we will learn how to use implicit styles, explicit styles, style inheritance and how to make styles apply to your own custom controls.

Using Styles in Xamarin.Forms: Implicit, Explicit and Inherit Styles by Gerald Versluis
